13. DURATION

  13.1. The present Agreement is effective as from 1 January 2009. It is established by calendar year and renewed tacitly every year.

  13.2. The Agreement rests, for all that, cancellable at any time by any of the parties before the expiry date of the Agreement or any of itsrenewals, upon three months prior written notice.
perturbation.changed_text:
13. DURATION

  13.1. The present Agreement is effective as from 1 January 2009. It is established by calendar year and renewed tacitly every year. This agreement can only be terminated at the end of the calendar year.

  13.2. The Agreement rests, for all that, cancellable at any time by any of the parties before the expiry date of the Agreement or any of itsrenewals, upon three months prior written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The modification to section 13.1 introducing the additional clause `This agreement can only be terminated at the end of the calendar year.` directly contradicts section 13.2 which allows cancellation 'at any time' with a three-month notice. This creates uncertainty about when the contract can actually be terminated.

perturbation.original_text:
7.1. TOTAL ANNUAL AMOUNT

The total annual amount to be paid, excluding taxes, for the year 2009, for the total provision of the services described in Article 2 of this Agreement, as well as the supervision of these (establishment of measurements and supervision meetings) will be:

TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND EUROS (200,000 €)

  7.1.1. This amount has been fixed for the two factories of Silicon Smelters: Polokwane and Rand Carbide, being the annualamount per factory A HUNDRED THOUSAND EUROS (100,000 €).

  7.1.2. If one of the factories closes down, the total amount due will be reduced pro rata for the rest of the annual period for thefactory's annual amount.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.1. TOTAL ANNUAL AMOUNT

The total annual amount to be paid, excluding taxes, for the year 2009, for the total provision of the services described in Article 2 of this Agreement, as well as the supervision of these (establishment of measurements and supervision meetings) will be:

TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND EUROS (200,000 €)

  7.1.1. This amount has been fixed for the two factories of Silicon Smelters: Polokwane and Rand Carbide, being the annualamount per factory A HUNDRED THOUSAND EUROS (100,000 €).

  7.1.2. If one of the factories closes down, the total amount due will be reduced at the sole discretion of the EIT, and will not necessarily be reduced pro rata for the rest of the annual period for thefactory's annual amount.
perturbation.explanation: By modifying section 7.1.2 to state that the reduction in amount due if a factory closes down is 'at the sole discretion of the EIT', it creates a contradiction with the original text, which states the amount 'will be reduced pro rata'. This generates uncertainty about the final amount due if one factory shuts down.

3.4. WORKSTATIONS AND PRINTERS

  3.4.1. The Customer is responsible for the purchase and maintenance of the workstations and printers.

  3.4.2. EIT commits to assist the Customer to implement a master that allows the quick installation of all the standard software inworkstations.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.4. WORKSTATIONS AND PRINTERS

  3.4.1. The Customer is responsible for the purchase and maintenance of the workstations and printers. EIT will also have shared responsibilities in maintaining workstations and printers.

  3.4.2. EIT commits to assist the Customer to implement a master that allows the quick installation of all the standard software inworkstations.
perturbation.explanation: By adding the clause `EIT will also have shared responsibilities in maintaining workstations and printers.` to section 3.4.1, it contradicts the prior clause that `The Customer is responsible for the purchase and maintenance of the workstations and printers.`. This creates an in-text contradiction because it is unclear what the level of responsibility the customer has, versus what level of responsibility EIT has. The wording is intentionally vague.
